entry.title: Galaxy Australia upgraded to Galaxy version 20.01

link.title: Galaxy Australia upgraded to Galaxy version 20.01

entry.content:
Galaxy Australia has been upgraded to the latest Galaxy release. Version 20.01.
This morning after a brief planned outage, Galaxy Australia was upgraded to the latest version of Galaxy. You will notice some changes straight away - The tool menu is a bit easier to read now. Everything else is the same however!

This release includes:

  • Workflow invocation view
  • More visualisations
  • More datatypes

Please see the user release notes for additional information.

Alternatively, see the full release notes
entry.summary: Galaxy Australia has been upgraded to the latest Galaxy release. Version 20.01. This morning after a brief planned outage, Galaxy Australia was upgraded to the latest version of Galaxy. You will notice some changes straight away - The tool menu is a bit easier to read now. Everything else is the same however!

entry.summary: The following tools have been installed/updated on Galaxy Australia

entry.title: Galaxy Version 20.01 Released
entry.content:
Galaxy 20.01 has now been released!
This release includes:

  • New workflow executions menu - track your workflow as it executes
  • Enhanced workflow functionality - optional parameters and more
  • Email notifications of completed jobs

Please see the user release notes for additional information.

Alternatively, see the full release notes.

Galaxy Australia will be moving to this Galaxy version in mid March. More information will be forthcoming.
entry.summary: Galaxy 20.01 has now been released! This release includes:

entry.title: Galaxy Australia contributes to global research effort into COVID-19

link.title: Galaxy Australia contributes to global research effort into COVID-19

entry.content:
A joint paper by Galaxy teams from Australia, Europe and the United States demonstrated how the COVID-19 genome data can be shared, analysed and reproduced in an efficient and transparent way. Find the paper at https://www.biocommons.org.au/galaxy-covid-19 and the workflows ready for use here in Galaxy Australia under Shared Data / Workflows.

Galaxy Australia Team
entry.summary: A joint paper by Galaxy teams from Australia, Europe and the United States demonstrated how the COVID-19 genome data can be shared, analysed and reproduced in an efficient and transparent way. Find the paper at https://www.biocommons.org.au/galaxy-covid-19 and the workflows ready for use here in Galaxy Australia under Shared Data / Workflows.

entry.title: GVL version 5 released!
entry.content:
The Genomics Virtual Lab (GVL) has had an update to version 5!

  • The GVL 5.0 is a ground-up rewrite of the GVL based on Kubernetes and containerization technologies
  • Production grade out of the box, with scalability, zero downtime configuration changes, better security, fully integrated Grafana metrics, containerized tools, as well as near equivalent toolset and reference data to usegalaxy.org
  • Easily launchable on 4 cloud providers - Amazon, Google, Jetstream, and NeCTAR, and can be manually installed in other Kubernetes environments
  • Launches with auto renewing SSL certificates and cloud DNS support
  • Unified authentication through KeyCloak
  • API-driven and fully programmable
  • Support for partitioning a GVL into multiple, isolated projects is under active development, including support for multiple applications in each project with access control lists

More details can be found at: https://galaxyproject.org/blog/2020-02-gvl5-beta/

Enis Afgan, Nuwan Goonasekera, Alexandru Mahmoud, Alex Ostrovsky, the GVL and Galaxy teams
entry.summary: The Genomics Virtual Lab (GVL) has had an update to version 5!

entry.title: Galaxy Training Network - Survey
entry.content:
We need your input on preparing and giving Galaxy Training

Do you use Galaxy for Training? Then the Galaxy Training Network wants your feedback. Please take a few minutes to let us know about your training experiences.

The survey should take no more than 10 minutes and will help us prioritise improvements to the training materials. Weâ€™re currently focused on making it easier to prepare and give training.

Thank you!

The GTN Community
entry.summary: We need your input on preparing and giving Galaxy Training

entry.title: One millionth job!
entry.content: Galaxy Australia has now processed over 1 million jobs! The tool run for the one millionth job was DeepTools bam coverage and completed at 8:55am on Wednesday the 29th of January 2020.
entry.summary: Galaxy Australia has now processed over 1 million jobs! The tool run for the one millionth job was DeepTools bam coverage and completed at 8:55am on Wednesday the 29th of January 2020.

entry.title: Summer Holiday Support
entry.content: Galaxy Australia will be minimally administered during the university shutdown period from 24th December 2019 to the 2nd January 2020. During this time, only essential maintenance will be performed. No disk quota modifications, tool installations or reference data installation or upgrades will be performed.
entry.summary: Galaxy Australia will be minimally administered during the university shutdown period from 24th December 2019 to the 2nd January 2020. During this time, only essential maintenance will be performed. No disk quota modifications, tool installations or reference data installation or upgrades will be performed.

entry.title: Galaxy Australia upgraded to Galaxy version 19.09

link.title: Galaxy Australia upgraded to Galaxy version 19.09

entry.content:
Galaxy Australia has been upgraded to the latest Galaxy release. Version 19.09.
This morning after a brief planned outage, Galaxy Australia was upgraded to the latest version of Galaxy. You will notice some changes straight away - The tool menu is a bit easier to read now. Everything else is the same however!

This release includes:

  • Workflow reporting
  • New visualisations
  • Cleaner history menu

Please see the user release notes for additional information.

Alternatively, see the full release notes
